channel.title: I'm thinking about installing Gentoo
channel.description:
I have had my eye on Gentoo for a long time, but I havn't done it yet because I have heard it is very difficult. I want to know, why exactly is it difficult? I should be able to install it, I am pretty good with computers, but I want to know what to expect before I go into it.
Edit:
I found this: [url=http://forum.notebookreview.com/showthread.php?t=49997]http://forum.notebookreview.com/showthread.php?t=49997[/url] Is it for real? Or fake?

item.title: I'm thinking about installing Gentoo
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I would install Gentoo itself, but I don’t really have the time to do it. And I am using a different computer right now, but I can’t use it for too long, so I’m not sure if the IRC will be an option. I will try, though.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm thinking about installing Gentoo
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

do you have an other pc around?
if so, come to irc.efak.net, i might be able to help you!
edit: it is smarter to install gentoo itself, not kororoaa, since you know what happens to your pc, and the handbook explains everything

Read full topic

item.title: I'm thinking about installing Gentoo
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Lol, I finished installing Gentoo (Used Kororaa so it didn’t take long), but it’s not detecting my network cards, so I don’t have internet. How do I configure xorg/kernel (or what ever holds the info on the cards) so they work?

Read full topic

item.title: I'm thinking about installing Gentoo
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

well, it isnt that difficult if you read the installation handbook, but ive had some problems
also: you need to have patience, since you will end up with just a console in the beginning, you then need to install a WM, i recommend installing either fluxbox or xfce4.

Read full topic
